thread.title: NAB, Nippon enter insurance MoU
thread.title_full: NAB, Nippon enter insurance MoU | Business Spectator

author: Mitchell Neems
title: NAB, Nippon enter insurance MoU
text:
Talks between National Australia Bank and Japan's Nippon Life Insurance appear to be slowly progressing with the parties entering a non-binding memorandum of understanding (MoU) regarding a long-term partnership in life insurance product manufacturing.
Talks between the two parties have been ongoing for months, with different reports at various times suggesting talks had collapsed or progressed to the point where the sale of NAB's life insurance arm was only months away .
Today, NAB stressed no final arrangements have been made, and that any potential future transaction is uncertain and subject to regulatory approvals.
"We have been exploring a potential partnership with the NAB Wealth insurance manufacturing business through the formation of a strategic partnership with major global insurance company Nippon Life,” NAB chief executive Andrew Thorburn said.
“We are committed to providing banking and wealth solutions for our customers and Nippon Life shares our passion for the customer and we are pleased to pursue how a partnership could enhance the experience for our customers.”
